TopicTitle: Re: Noob - Can someone tell me what's wrong?

Articles.Content:
New link, please use this one for reference. Thanks

Photos: http://imgur.com/a/1aSH4

Some suggestions:

2nd pic: You don't need the yellow fuel lines. Tanks one above the other are always linked, and you could replace those two tanks with one larger one of the same capacity, reducing part count.

Fins on the upper stages aren't terribly useful in atmo, and become dead weight out of it. Discard them with the lower stages.

One set of lights should be more than sufficient.

Right now, nose cones are placeholders and don't actually reduce air resistence. In fact, they add to drag and weight.

It looks like the side boosters have fuel lines that will cause loops in the fuel flow, which perplexes the game's software and can cause all kinds of weirdnesses. I'm afraid I don't see what you're intending to achieve there. The fuel should be able to simply flow from one tank to another, emptying from the top down of each of those side columns, without assistance.

Just generally too much of everything. Many more parts of all kinds than you need, and the total is about 2 or 3 times the size that a moon rocket needs to be.

Do you have a source of electrical power on there?

The part that made me laugh was that you used fuel lines on the SRBs.

With your current configuration, you shouldn't need fuel lines at all.

One more thing: your landing legs are too short for the engine beneath it.
